BIO

Hi, I'm Lawrence! I am a passionate programmer who enjoys learning about software solutions. I have worked by myself and with my colleagues to build amazing websites, web applications, and mobile applications that are practical, enticing, and user-friendly. Below is detailed information about my experience as a programmer.

May 2023 - Present

Coding Minds Academy

Software Development Engineer Intern

Developing a new full-stack web application utilizing Django, Bootstrap CSS, and Firebase for student assessments

Responsible for selecting a Bootstrap template and integrating the components to fit the software requirements and to modernize the application

In 2 months closed over 20 tickets related to frontend issues, heavily focused on Django templates and JS

Explored methods to increase the quality of the user experience for schoolchildren to prevent information overload

May 2023 - Present

One Community Global

Full Stack Software Engineer Volunteer

Contributing 10 hours a week to a MERN stack open source team management project used by One Community Global

Reviewed over 15 pull requests on the GitHub repositories increasing code quality and reducing a number of bugs

Collaborated with other developers and managers to investigate and troubleshoot bugs and brainstorm new features

Oct 2021 - June 2022

Coding Minds Academy

Software Development Engineer Intern

Developed existing full-stack web application used daily by 150+ organization users (instructors, students, and managers) using React.js, Loopback 3 Node.js API framework, and MongoDB Atlas

Communicated with managers to implement existing or entirely new pages and features with React components and RESTful API models

In 6 months closed 23 tickets related to frontend issues, heavily focused on JS with some CSS bugs as well

Sept 2020 - Dec 2020

ACM Chapter Computer Science Society (CSS)

Front End Developer

Utilized React Native to build an Android application that helps students manage club events

Collaborated with a student-ran team of frontend and UI/UX developers

Followed Agile Project Management methodology

Aug 2020 - May 2021

Software Engineering Association (SEA)

Treasurer and Historian

Organized club meetings that taught practical, technical skills outside of the CS curriculum

Relayed and managed club budget and finances from the Engineering Student Council to the E-Board

Managed newly created social medias, MailChimp email list, and website
